examples: If I had been ill-natured, I should have shown up the little great man, who had once belabored me in his feeble way.
… ancient battles in which the combatants belabored one another with swords, staffs, cudgels, halberds and other heavy-duty weapons until the blood flowed …

definition: to explain or insist on excessively
examples: her habit of belaboring the obvious
